titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale University Women's Organization Oral History Project Records
Yale University Women's Organization Oral History Project Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Mary Caldera and Alexandrine Koontz

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:33

did.unittitle: Yale University Women's Organization oral history project records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of audiotapes, a videotape, transcripts, and project and background files relating to "One Story, Many Voices: An Oral History of the Yale University Women's Organization."

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 40 (YRG 40), Records of Yale clubs, societies and organizations.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were transferred from the Yale University Women's Organization, 2003.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale University Women's Organization Oral History Project Records (RU 924). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by record type.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Yale University Women's Organization was established in 1965. The organization is open to women members of the Yale community, including faculty, staff, wives of faculty and staff, and other women affiliated with the university. Its main activities include educational lectures, social events, and a scholarship program. The organization undertook an oral history project in 1999, culminating in videotape, One Story, Many Voices: An Oral History of the Yale University Women's Organization. The project documents the founding and activities of the organization, spousal privileges, the Yale Newcomer's Club, and the Information and Counseling Center for Women (Yale Women's Center).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of audiotapes, a videotape, transcripts, and project and background files relating to "One Story, Many Voices: An Oral History of the Yale University Women's Organization."

did.unittitle: Yale University Women's Organization history project records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records are arranged in two sections: Project and Background Files and Interviews. The project and background files include a subject index and an appendix of material related to the history of the Yale University Women's Organization, which supplements the information provided by the interviewees. Cross references link specific interviews to related material in the appendix.

did.unittitle: Subject index with numbered list of interviewees and interviewers
